when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！ (arigatou, tetsudatte kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used when parting from someone, typically for a long time.
example: 友達にさようならを言いました。(Tomodachi ni sayounara o iimashita.) - I said goodbye to my friend.

when_to_say: Used as a morning greeting.
example: おはようございます。(Ohayou gozaimasu.) - Good morning!

when_to_say: Used as a daytime greeting.
example: こんにちは、お元気ですか？ (Konnichiwa, ogenki desu ka?) - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: Used as an evening greeting.
example: こんばんは、どうしましたか？ (Konbanwa, doushimashita ka?) - Good evening, what happened?

when_to_say: Used to describe something aesthetically pleasing.
example: この景色は美しいです。(Kono keshiki wa utsukushii desu.) - This scenery is beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to describe an enjoyable activity or experience.
example: 今日は楽しかったです。(Kyou wa tanoshikatta desu.) - Today was fun.

when_to_say: Used to express concern about someone or something.
example: 彼のことが心配です。(Kare no koto ga shinpai desu.) - I am worried about him.

when_to_say: Used when referring to eating food.
example: お寿司を食べました。(Osushi o tabemashita.) - I ate sushi.

when_to_say: Used when referring to drinking beverages.
example: お茶を飲みます。(Ocha o nomimasu.) - I will drink tea.

when_to_say: Used to talk about going somewhere.
example: 学校に行きます。(Gakkou ni ikimasu.) - I am going to school.

when_to_say: Used to describe coming to a place.
example: 彼は明日来ます。(Kare wa ashita kimasu.) - He is coming tomorrow.

when_to_say: Used to talk about seeing or watching something.
example: 映画を見ます。(Eiga o mimasu.) - I will watch a movie.

when_to_say: Used when referring to listening or hearing.
example: 音楽を聞きます。(Ongaku o kikimasu.) - I will listen to music.

when_to_say: Used when talking about speaking or conversing.
example: 日本語を話します。(Nihongo o hanashimasu.) - I speak Japanese.

when_to_say: Used when referring to running.
example: 公園で走ります。(Kouen de hashirimasu.) - I run in the park.

when_to_say: Used when purchasing something.
example: パンを買います。(Pan o kaimasu.) - I will buy bread.

when_to_say: Used when referring to selling something.
example: その店で服を売っています。(Sono mise de fuku o utteimasu.) - They sell clothes in that store.

when_to_say: Used to express preference or fondness for something.
example: 私は猫が好きです。(Watashi wa neko ga suki desu.) - I like cats.

when_to_say: Used to express dislike or aversion.
example: 私は虫が嫌いです。(Watashi wa mushi ga kirai desu.) - I dislike insects.

when_to_say: Used when referring to reading books or other materials.
example: 本を読みます。(Hon o yomimasu.) - I will read a book.

when_to_say: Used when referring to writing letters, essays, etc.
example: 日記を書きます。(Nikki o kakimasu.) - I write a diary.

when_to_say: Used when referring to one's occupation or tasks.
example: 私は仕事があります。(Watashi wa shigoto ga arimasu.) - I have work to do.

when_to_say: Used to address or refer to teachers or instructors.
example: 先生に質問しました。(Sensei ni shitsumon shimashita.) - I asked the teacher a question.

when_to_say: Used to refer to someone who studies at school or university.
example: 私は学生です。(Watashi wa gakusei desu.) - I am a student.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a friend or companion.
example: 友達と遊びます。(Tomodachi to asobimasu.) - I play with my friend.

when_to_say: Used when talking about time or duration.
example: 時間がありません。(Jikan ga arimasen.) - I don't have time.

meaning: to rest, to take a break
when_to_say: Used to talk about taking a rest or day off.
example: 少し休みます。(Sukoshi yasumimasu.) - I will rest a little.

when_to_say: Used when referring to going on a trip or vacation.
example: 旅行が好きです。(Ryokou ga suki desu.) - I like traveling.

when_to_say: Used when referring to making or receiving a phone call.
example: 電話をします。(Denwa o shimasu.) - I will make a call.

when_to_say: Used when talking about writing or receiving letters.
example: 手紙を書きます。(Tegami o kakimasu.) - I write a letter.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a cat as a pet or animal.
example: 猫がかわいいです。(Neko ga kawaii desu.) - Cats are cute.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a dog as a pet or animal.
example: 犬が走っています。(Inu ga hashitteimasu.) - The dog is running.

when_to_say: Used when talking about mountains or hiking.
example: 山に登ります。(Yama ni noborimasu.) - I climb mountains.

when_to_say: Used when talking about vehicles or transportation.
example: 車で行きます。(Kuruma de ikimasu.) - I will go by car.

when_to_say: Used when describing something that is new or recently made.
example: 新しい家です。(Atarashii ie desu.) - It is a new house.

when_to_say: Used when describing something that is old or aged.
example: 古い本があります。(Furui hon ga arimasu.) - I have an old book.

when_to_say: Used when describing speed or time.
example: 彼はとても早いです。(Kare wa totemo hayai desu.) - He is very fast.

when_to_say: Used when describing slowness or tardiness.
example: バスは遅れています。(Basu wa okureteimasu.) - The bus is late.

when_to_say: Used when referring to consuming food.
example: 寿司を食べます。(Sushi o tabemasu.) - I eat sushi.

when_to_say: Used when referring to consuming beverages.
example: お茶を飲みます。(Ocha o nomimasu.) - I drink tea.

when_to_say: Used when referring to seeing or observing something.
example: 映画を見ます。(Eiga o mimasu.) - I watch a movie.

when_to_say: Used when referring to listening or inquiring.
example: 音楽を聞きます。(Ongaku o kikimasu.) - I listen to music.

when_to_say: Used when referring to meeting someone.
example: 友達に会います。(Tomodachi ni aimasu.) - I will meet my friend.

when_to_say: Used when referring to running.
example: 公園で走ります。(Kouen de hashirimasu.) - I run in the park.

when_to_say: Used when referring to purchasing something.
example: りんごを買います。(Ringo o kaimasu.) - I buy apples.

when_to_say: Used when referring to selling goods.
example: 店で本を売ります。(Mise de hon o urimasu.) - I sell books at the store.

when_to_say: Used when describing height or cost.
example: この家は高いです。(Kono ie wa takai desu.) - This house is expensive.

when_to_say: Used when describing affordability.
example: このペンは安いです。(Kono pen wa yasui desu.) - This pen is cheap.

when_to_say: Used when describing clear weather.
example: 今日は晴れです。(Kyou wa hare desu.) - It is sunny today.

when_to_say: Used when describing rainy weather.
example: 雨が降っています。(Ame ga futteimasu.) - It is raining.

when_to_say: Used when describing snowy weather.
example: 山に雪があります。(Yama ni yuki ga arimasu.) - There is snow on the mountain.

when_to_say: Used when describing windy conditions.
example: 風が強いです。(Kaze ga tsuyoi desu.) - The wind is strong.

when_to_say: Used when referring to the sun.
example: 太陽が昇ります。(Taiyou ga noborimasu.) - The sun rises.

when_to_say: Used when referring to the moon.
example: 月がきれいです。(Tsuki ga kirei desu.) - The moon is beautiful.

when_to_say: Used when referring to stars.
example: 星がたくさん見えます。(Hoshi ga takusan miemasu.) - Many stars are visible.

when_to_say: Used when referring to the sky.
example: 空が青いです。(Sora ga aoi desu.) - The sky is blue.

when_to_say: Used when referring to rivers or streams.
example: 川で泳ぎます。(Kawa de oyogimasu.) - I swim in the river.

when_to_say: Used when referring to mountains.
example: 山に登ります。(Yama ni noborimasu.) - I climb mountains.

when_to_say: Used when referring to the sea or ocean.
example: 海で泳ぎます。(Umi de oyogimasu.) - I swim in the sea.

when_to_say: Used when referring to forests or woods.
example: 森で散歩します。(Mori de sanpo shimasu.) - I walk in the forest.

when_to_say: Used when referring to flowers.
example: 花が咲きます。(Hana ga sakimasu.) - Flowers bloom.

when_to_say: Used when referring to birds.
example: 鳥が飛んでいます。(Tori ga tondeimasu.) - The bird is flying.
